DataElement.preferredName: Post Surgical Procedure Neoplasm Assessment Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of tumor following a definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of tumor following a definitive surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An enumerated list of values indicating the status of the patient's tumor after a surgical procedure (excision).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: IIc: Microscopic residual, margin positive, nodes positive (completely resected)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: IIc: Microscopic residual, margin positive, nodes positive (completely resected)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: IIb: Microscopic residual, margin negative, nodes positive (completely resected)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: IIb: Microscopic residual, margin negative, nodes positive (completely resected)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: IIa: Microscopic residual, margin positive, nodes negative
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: IIa: Microscopic residual, margin positive, nodes negative

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).
A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
